review.summary: Clean __init__.py file that properly exposes the three core event system protocols (EventRepositoryProtocol, EventPublisherProtocol, EventProcessorProtocol) following neo-commons platform architecture patterns. The file serves its single purpose of providing a clean API boundary for the protocols package with comprehensive __all__ list for explicit public API control.

positive_observations.positive: Follows neo-commons __init__.py pattern with comprehensive __all__ list for explicit public API control
Clean relative imports using dot notation consistent with feature-first organization
Protocol naming convention followed correctly (all protocols end with "Protocol")
Proper module docstring providing clear purpose
Minimal and focused - serves single purpose of API boundary without unnecessary complexity
Consistent with platform architecture: protocols define contracts for dependency injection

context.tests: No tests needed for simple __init__.py import aggregation file
context.documentation: Has appropriate module docstring, related protocols are well documented
